results.title: What is SPSS? (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introducing Spss”.
What SPSS can do; command input and batch mode; documentation. Data in SPSS; cases and variables; rectangular format; coding and missing values; fixed format data preparation; codebooks; data validation.

results.title: Introducing Chemistry
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Formulas and equations
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Introducing Chemistry”.
This is the first of three films for a beginning unit in chemistry. It explains and demonstrates the basic language of chemistry, the symbols used in formulas and equations. Acids, bases and salts are defined in terms of their formulas. Basic terms encountered include compound, gas, precipitate and radical as well as the concepts of structural formulas and “balanced” equations.

results.title: How atoms combine [B&W]
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introducing Chemistry”.
Three basic types of atomic bonding are clearly and simply illustrated: covalent bonding in which there is an equal sharing of electrons by two or more atoms; polar covalent bonding in which one atom has a greater share than the others; and ionic bonding in which one atom seems to take nearly full control of the electrons from the other atom or radical.

results.title: Types of chemical change
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introducing Chemistry”
Introduces four basic types of chemical reactions: direct combination, decomposition, simple displacement and double displacement.

results.title: How atoms combine
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introducing Chemistry”.
Introduces chemical bonding by explaining the different ways in which atoms combine. Illustrates covalent bonds by showing models of hydrogen atoms, their shell structure and methods of bonding. Employs water molecules as examples of polar covalent bonds and sodium chloride molecules as examples of ionic bonds.

results.title: Tanzania: path for a nation
results.creator_credit: Ben Park, Gilbert Lauzun and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “International zone”
President of Tanzania, Julius Nyerere, the guide in this film, explains his country’s determination to seek a single citizenship for all its people, to overcome problems of hunger, poverty and ignorance without putting the country in debt to outside exploiters, and to build new systems of cooperation at all levels.

results.title: Submerged glory
results.creator_credit: Frank Jacoby, Alistair Cooke and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “International zone”
In every continent there are milestones which mark humanity’s progress from pre-history to the age of the atom. From the temples in Cambodia to the Cathedral in Chartres, these creations stand as a common treasure. Today the temples of Nubia are threatened with inundation by the waters soon to rise at the Aswan Dam; Unesco has called for a worldwide effort to save them.

results.title: The Sixth continent
results.creator_credit: Gilbert Lauzun, George Movshon and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “International Zone”.
Discusses the unexploited resources of the sea bed, scientific investigations in progress, the danger of pollution and questions of ownership.
